moves.1. d4: Marshall elects to try a QP opening.
moves.1... Nf6: Torre replies with an Indian defense.
moves.2... Nc6: I believe Alekhine was the man who popularized moving both Knights out before moving the Pawns as Black in this position. I'm sure someone will correct me if I am mistaken.
moves.4... e6: Opening a line for the Q and B, while attacking the advanced QP.
moves.5... Bb4+: Developing aggressively and setting a pitfall.
moves.6. Nd2: A horrendous blunder. The correct response is 6 B-B3.
moves.7... Qf6: ...overlooking this devastating response. Marshall resigns at once.
